intro: Humboltia foveata, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a fibrous root system and a rosette of narrow, linear leaves. It produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink. Humboltia foveata is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with minimal water availability.
